THE UNIVERSITY OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK
THE STATE EDUCATION DEPARTMENT
ALBANY 1
THE DEPUTY COMMISSIONER OF EDUCATION
OFFICE OF
GLENN STARLIN
DIRECTOR, INTERINSTITUTIONAL
TELEVISION PROJECT
November 9, 1961
Dr. Samuel L. Becker, Chairman
NAEB Research Committee
Division of Television, Radio, Film
State University of Iowa
Iowa City, Iowa
Dear Sam:
I am sorry that I didn't have a chance to see you except for a
moment at the NAEB meeting in Washington. I never did know whether the
NAEB Research Committee had a meeting and I am chagrir/Jthat I did not
answer your letter of September 27 regarding t his. It was delayed in
getting to me since I was en route from Oregon for several weeks at that
particular time. As I told you when we bumped into each other at the
Marriott Hotel, I am now in New York State doing a study on the potential
of television in higher education with the possibility of developing a
state wide ETV network. If there are any developments in terms of other
ETV stations in Iowa or plans for any sort of a state network, I would
appreciate your sending me information of this nature on to me. ETV
developments in other states will be of particular interest to powers
that be here in the State of New York.
I trust that all is going well with you and yours at. the University
of Iowa. I regret I didn't have a chance to talk with you at greater
length but perhaps I will^t to see you at the Speech Association meeting
in New York City right after Christmas. If I can be of any assistance,
from a distance, as far as the NAEB Research Committee is concerned, please
call upon me. Extend my best to Clay Harshbarger the next time you see him.
Kindest personal regards.
